content.question: ​The leading term of the polynomial function <math alttext="p"><mi>p</mi></math> is <math alttext="a subscript n x to the power of n"><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><msup><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></msup></math>, where <math alttext="a subscript n"><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>n</mi></msub></math> is a real number and <math alttext="n"><mi>n</mi></math> is a positive integer. The factors of <math alttext="p"><mi>p</mi></math> include <math alttext="open parentheses x minus 3 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>, <math alttext="open parentheses x minus i close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>i</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>, and <math alttext="open parentheses x minus open parentheses 2 plus i close parentheses close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mfenced><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>i</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>. What is the least possible value of <math alttext="n"><mi>n</mi></math> ?

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
